references.paper_title: Some signals and rules for taking speaking turns in conversations
references.reason: This paper is foundational in the field of turn-taking research, providing early insights into the signals and rules that govern conversation dynamics.

references.paper_title: Ego4D: Around the world in 3,000 hours of egocentric video
references.reason: This paper introduces a large-scale egocentric video dataset, Ego4D, which is crucial for training and evaluating egocentric conversational agents.

references.paper_title: Towards a general, continuous model of turn-taking in spoken dialogue using LSTM recurrent neural networks
references.reason: This paper presents a continuous turn-taking model which is essential to the real-time speech initiation prediction in the current paper.

references.paper_title: Turn-taking in conversational systems and human-robot interaction: a review
references.reason: This review paper provides a comprehensive overview of turn-taking research, summarizing existing methods and highlighting challenges which are directly addressed in this paper.

references.paper_title: Timing in turn-taking and its implications for processing models of language
references.reason: This paper offers psycholinguistic insights into the timing of turn-taking in human conversations, providing valuable context for the real-time prediction task of the current paper.
